content.name: Health
content.desc: People's general health and caring responsibilities.

variables.name: Disability
variables.desc: People with a long-term health problem or disability, including conditions relating to old-age.
variables.long_desc: People who assessed their day-to-day activities as limited by long-term physical or mental health conditions or illnesses are considered disabled. This definition of a disabled person meets the harmonised standard for measuring disability and is in line with the Equality Act (2010).
variables.caveat_text: Figures for this variable are age standardised.

variables.name: General health
variables.desc: How people rate their general health.
variables.long_desc: A person's assessment of the general state of their health from very good to very bad. This assessment is not based on a person's health over any specified period of time.
variables.caveat_text: Figures for this variable are age standardised.

variables.name: Provision of unpaid care
variables.long_desc:
An unpaid carer may look after, give help or support to anyone who has long-term physical or mental ill-health conditions, illness or problems related to old age.  

This does not include any activities as part of paid employment. 

This help can be within or outside of the carer's household.
variables.caveat_text: Figures for this variable are age standardised.
